Toru then watches Sam, Mina and Sakura in a threesome, where preferably the girls are too rapturous to defend Toru from Sam's vituperation (Toru is weak, inferior, etc.) After Toru witnesses this he has a choice to make. In the next scene, his decision is evident as he and a heavily pregnant Sakura are exchanging wedding vows as his parents and little Sara are in the crowd looking on. Meanwhile, Sam has returned home and has more or less forgotten his temporary family as he is quickly starting a new one with his patient girlfriend.

There should have been one more chapter for Sakura's sake. At the end of this chapter Sam could have enlisted Mina's aid, as he was impregnating her with Sara, to have Toru spend an evening with Sakura in order to fool him in a similar manner to his father while getting him to "take responsibility" and propose marriage(getting Mina to effectively give up a biological grandchild while at the mercy of passion) . Toru would have heard all this as he heard the original scheme but the thought of letting it go forward while his mother, his girlfriend and the exchange student all cooperate behind his back and think him very foolish for so easily allowing the wool to be pulled over his eyes would very much sit well with his character. After his time with Sakura, his mother could extricate Sakura under the pretense of going shopping, for example, and Toru could trail them to the scene. I rather like idea of him seeing his own mother administering the medicine to kill her son's sperm.
